====Trivia====
This is one of only three everyday kanji with a 5 morae reading, and one of only two nouns, namely {{m|ja|志|tr=こころざし, kokorozashi}} (nominalization of form of verb {{m|ja|志す|tr=こころざす, kokorozasu}}, which has a four-mora reading). The only other kanji with five-mora readings are {{m|ja|承}}, in the verb {{m|ja|承る|tr=（うけたまわ）る, uketamawa-ru}}, and {{m|ja|詔||tr=みことのり, mikotonori}}. No kanji in common use has a six- or more mora reading.

The unusually long reading is due to two factors: 志 is a nominalization of the verb 志す which has a long reading (4 morae, ''kokoroza-su''), which itself is a noun-verb compound, 心指す ''kokoro-za(su)''. The nominalization removing the okurigana, hence increasing the reading by one morae, yielding 4+1=5, or more finely 3+(1+1)=5 (compare common {{m|ja|話|tr=はなし, hanashi}} 2+1=3, from {{m|ja|話す|tr=はなす, hana-su}}).
